bio

I am a 2nd year PhD student in the Department of Biostatistics at Johns Hopkins University. Currently, I am working on developing statistical methods to estimate the risk of cancer and other diseases as a research assistant for Cristian Tomasetti.

I received my bachelorâ€™s in math and statistics from the University of Chicago in 2016. In my free time, you are likely to find me reading, watching tennis, or sleeping.
